revised_title: An Experiment to Prove an Interspersed Vacuum and Disprove the Equality of Places in Terms of Fullness
tldr: The author conducts an experiment to prove the existence of an interspersed vacuum and disprove the idea that all places are equally full. The experiment involves dropping a Guinea and a piece of paper in a long, multi-chambered glass receiver, demonstrating that the presence of an interspersed vacuum affects the fall of objects.
